Description: Rim and wall fragment of East Greek pottery cup (South Ionian pottery little master cup). Outside: rim reserved except for a 0.3 cm band at lip; band at join with handle zone, which is reserved and has added plastic hand; glaze dots on knuckles. Inside; bowl glazed; turn to lip reserved; lip reserved with bands at top and bottom.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Schlotzhauer Ionian Cup Type with application
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the shape and decoration find parallels with his South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9B. For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.1219 and 1888,0601.606. For parallels regarding the shape and decoration, see See Berlin 3678 from Rhodes (Samos 6.1, pl.42 no. 346).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 51, no. 175 pl. 41)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 258)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.755) (Phase 3)
